description:
Cryphonectria parasitica EP155 is a fungal species that belongs to the Ascomycota phylum. It is a plant pathogen, primarily known for causing chestnut blight, a devastating disease that has had a significant impact on chestnut tree populations in North America and Europe.

Cryphonectria parasitica EP155 is a filamentous, ascomycete fungus that reproduces both sexually and asexually. The fungus infects the bark and cambium of chestnut trees, causing cankers that can eventually girdle and kill the tree. The species produces orange-colored spore-bearing structures called stromata, which are a distinctive feature of the disease.

Genetically, Cryphonectria parasitica EP155 is a specific strain or isolate of the C. parasitica species, with the "EP155" designation referring to its identification or classification number. This strain may exhibit unique genetic or phenotypic characteristics that differentiate it from other C. parasitica isolates.

The study of Cryphonectria parasitica EP155 is important for understanding the biology and epidemiology of chestnut blight, as well as for developing effective management strategies to protect chestnut tree populations and mitigate the impacts of this devastating fungal disease.
